column4: I installed gnome-randr-applet but i can' figure out how to add it to the panel (the obvious method doesn't work) ubunut 11.04
do you *know the command, my typo.
i nkow of a way to add xrandr to it. no the command for the gnome version?
i know how to execute randr from the command line. i was hoping to use an applet
i figured as much, but i was wondering what the command is to run the gui randr program.
i didn't know there was a gui for it
ohh, my bad. I thought you had installed a gui program for it. so you want to know what gui9 programs are available then?
i installed an applet, which i guess in the strictest sense is a gui program.  Right clicking on the bar and adding an applet doesn't show the randr applet in the list of available ones
i see. what is the name of the applet.
did you log out or reboot?
why would I do that? it's an applet:-p
no, i havn't. i'll have to check it once i do
sorry man, i cant find anything on that prog. if you alt-f2 and then type in gnome-randr-applet, what happens?
ok, let's go another route, maybe we can find another program to do a similar task? or do you need this to be available at all times on the app bar?
so when you right click the top bar, and choose add to panel, it just simply does not exist...

the only other option i can see would be to go into the system menu, under preferences and drag the monitors icon or the nvidia/ati icons frm there to your top nav bar, which then would atleast give you quick access to it. sorry man that's the best i can do. as a side note you might try removing and then re-installing the app.
